title: Its funny how people say this is the worst Pre-Season ever since we started.
body:
Its like people forgot Preseason 3

Welcome to the league of {{item:3071}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3071}}

replies.body: sorry but not even close, there's a huge difference between having ONE item be broken vs all the shit that is broken now
If so much shit is so broken, it just means there's a lot of options to fight broken vs broken.

> [{quoted}](name=Postal Badger,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ga0Au2Na,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-11-19T17:09:30.183+0000)
>
> If so much shit is so broken, it just means there's a lot of options to fight broken vs broken.

sorry but what? i rather have ONE broken thing in the game than have a ton of broken things in it. I can deal and learn how to deal with a single broken thing, not when almost everything is broken at the same time. That doesn't make the game "better" or more "fun" or anything it makes it a hassle to play

Preseason 5, patch 4.20: {{champion:19}} {{item:1415}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3091}} 
{{summoner:11}} + Ult = instakill EVERYTHING EVER

Broken champs are far less annoying than a broken game mode. Buffed minions for teams that are ahead. Towers that now take on-hits and, well, melt regardless around the 10-minute mark. Herald buffs that allow you to steamroll a lane baron-style before you've even finished your second item.

Riot had to know what they were doing when they made these changes. SR now cascades in one direction for about 10 minutes before laning phase even finishes, which is enough to make about 90% of players quit, apparently, as soon as the 20 minute mark hits. I can't even PLAY sr, for all intents and purposes, because the good part never comes. For me it was all about testing your mettle with calculated builds in late-game teamfights... which no longer exist now. Thanks Riot.

I would take an enemy ninjassassin-warwick in SR any day over an SR that essentially isn't a game anymore. I don't count 30% of a game as a game, and 30% is all I can get out of SR.
The minions thing hasn't actually gone through yet.

I stand corrected. Well that's good. Let's hope it never does go through. I thought that was why minions were constantly backdooring when one team was behind on towers. Maybe it was just a coincidence, or more people catching on to how to set up minion waves.
Likely just people pushing super hard. Clearing waves has never been easier with the new Shiv.
Yeah, shiv/rageblade are the new tiamats (RIP tiamat...)

broken champs are way worse than a broken game since you can ban champs or pick a super niche counterpick that makes them useless (Janna wrecks WW for instance). Can you ban gold generation or jungle being harder?
Personally I found the release devourer/feral flare situation far more asinine than the Black Cleaver, but I can see where you're coming from.

Even with the leauge of cleavers, Riot still had a general direction they were going.  It was bad, but there was a light at the end of the tunnel.  Now it's just... everythings overpowered, towers are useless -- it's hard to forsee how Riot's going to fix everything, or what horrid meta they'll force for S6.
AP Yi is a thing again.
